summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from June 2008 regarding the finalization of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement. It involves coordination between a prosecutor, defense attorneys, and law enforcement officials to ensure the plea complies with a prior non-prosecution agreement and to prepare for the upcoming hearing, including victim notification.

persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the state plea agreement is in compliance with the September 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, copied on the official Notice of Non-Compliance letter from the prosecutor.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant subject to the plea agreement and non-prosecution agreement regarding state charges.

persons.name: Joe
persons.context: Spoken to about jail logistics; indicated the Palm Beach County Detention Center is the jail for sentences under a year and that the Sheriff determines how the sentence is carried out.

persons.name: Dave
persons.context: Mentioned in agreement with Joe regarding the Palm Beach County Detention Center being the designated jail.

persons.name: The Chief
persons.context: Spoken to about serving time at the jail and calling victims to inform them of the upcoming plea hearing.

persons.name: The Sheriff
persons.context: The Chief spoke to the Sheriff about serving the sentence at the jail.

persons.name: The Colonel
persons.context: A colonel at the jail who was met with previously; plans are to meet again to reiterate their position if the plea goes well.

persons.name: Ms. Villafana
persons.context: Addressee of Jack Goldberger's email confirming the telephone conference about the plea agreement's compliance.

keyFacts: The state plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein was being finalized to comply with a September 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The anticipated sentence involved six months of incarceration at the Palm Beach County Detention Center, followed by one year of community control.
Law enforcement (The Chief) was preparing to notify victims about the upcoming plea hearing.
Defense attorneys Jack Goldberger and Roy Black were actively involved in negotiating and confirming the terms of the plea deal.
There was surprise expressed that there had been no press coverage of the impending plea agreement at that time.
